<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/Crypto-Executives-Testify-First-Congressional-Hearing?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Crypto Comes to Washington
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/Crypto-Executives-Testify-First-Congressional-Hearing?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Digital tokens falling into the Capitol building " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/681474c96379e4b5d7b4ced5bf7092dc3b831fae-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francis Scialabba </em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2021, crypto showed up in high-art circles, on NBA jerseys, and in more investment portfolios. So it’s not a surprise that, for the first time ever, the sector also <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/crypto-ceos-to-testify-before-lawmakers-weighing-greater-regulation-11638959403?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made an appearance</a> in the halls of Capitol Hill.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Six executives from leading crypto firms, including FTX and Coinbase, testified before the House Financial Services Committee yesterday. It’s part of Congress’s “fact-finding mission” into how to regulate an industry that’s been subject to spottier oversight than the boys in <em>Lord of the Flies</em>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In the nearly 13 years since bitcoin was first introduced, cryptocurrencies have ballooned into a ~$2.6 trillion asset class.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Yet the industry is governed by a patchwork of laws rather than an overarching regulatory framework.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So how should it be policed?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Unsurprisingly, industry leaders and lawmakers don’t exactly see eye to eye.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Crypto execs </strong>generally want low-touch, <a href="https://www.reuters.com/markets/europe/us-risks-chilling-regulations-crypto-industry-warns-congress-2021-12-07/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">custom regulations</a> that promote competition and innovation around blockchain technology. Coinbase CFO Alesia Haas argued yesterday that heavy-handed rules would “effectively push crypto activity underground” or outside the US.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Haas said that crypto markets are fundamentally different from traditional financial markets, and should be treated by regulators as such.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Lawmakers, </strong>specifically Democrats, have a number of concerns with how the crypto industry currently operates, including the amount of energy consumed during the mining process and the potential for fraud.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>They’re especially spooked by “</span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/17/business/economy/federal-reserve-virtual-currency-stablecoin.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stablecoins</a></span><span>,” which are cryptocurrencies typically pegged to government-backed currencies. Stablecoins have surged to become a $140 billion market, but regulators think they’re not quite as “stable” as they claim and actually risk </span><span><em>de</em></span><span>stabilizing financial markets.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Both crypto leaders and government regulators agree that some rules of the road are needed for the industry to be sustainable. “Few technologies in history, since antiquity, can persist for long periods of time outside of public policy frameworks,” SEC Chair Gary Gensler <a href="https://www.wsj.com/livecoverage/wsj-ceo-council-tesla-intel-reddit-pfizer/card/MsUND2c5kqPJC9qYeOAk?mod=article_inline" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a>.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/Pfizer-BioNTech-Covid-booster-effective-against-Omicron?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Against Omicron, the Third Shot's the Charm
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/Pfizer-BioNTech-Covid-booster-effective-against-Omicron?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Lotto card showing three vaccine shots " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/2fdd019d7066fab50ac5b4af8c3af0b7cff39cc0-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Dianna "Mick" McDougall</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The question on everyone’s mind this holiday season: Will existing Covid vaccines work against the new variant, Omicron?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Early results show that yes, they can, but only after you get knocked on your couch for a <a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-science-business-health-coronavirus-vaccine-46a0cedcefcc938ba84ea2868bf69db1?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">third time</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pfizer and its vaccine partner BioNTech released preliminary data yesterday that showed booster shots come as advertised—they increase the level of Omicron-fighting antibodies by 25x when compared to a 2-shot regimen. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Disclaimer: </strong></span><span>These results haven’t gotten the ol’ “peer-reviewed” stamp yet, and need to be scrutinized further.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, this is encouraging news, considering early observations of Omicron sparked concern that existing vaccines wouldn’t be able to neutralize the variant at all. In case more protection is needed, Pfizer and BioNTech are working on an Omicron-specific booster they said could be available by March 2022.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>These results add another wrinkle in the debate over what dosage indicates someone is “fully vaccinated.” Dr. Fauci <a href="https://www.axios.com/fauci-fully-vaccinated-definition-covid-pandemic-e32be159-821a-4a5e-bdfb-20e233567685.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told CNN</a> yesterday that “it’s going to be a matter of when, not if” the definition changes.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/Better-CEO-Vishal-Garg-apologized-laying-off-900-employees?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Do Better.com
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Vishal Garg, CEO of mortgage company Better.com, broke out a classic exec move and said he was sorry for not respecting his employees. On Tuesday, Garg sent an <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/bettercom-ceo-laid-900-workers-zoom-apologizes-current-staff-rcna8028?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">apology letter</a> to staff after he laid off 900 employees—at least 9% of the company's total—on a Zoom call last week that had the energy of a middle school surprise anti-drug assembly. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“I own the decision to do the layoffs, but in communicating it I blundered the execution,” wrote Garg.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">He didn’t even have a fun background.</strong> The CEO’s curt layoff message was followed by a number of frustrated employees <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/hr/stories/2021/12/08/the-host-will-fire-you-now-better-com-ceo-fires?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">venting</a> on the anonymous discussion website, Blind. Then Garg decided things could only get more fun with the boss around and wrote a series of posts on the same site accusing at least 250 former employees of “stealing” by only working “two hours a day” while clocking in for eight.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The fallout:</strong> After a rocky week, Better.com’s PR leaders responded by...leaving. Three top communications execs resigned as of yesterday. Plus, the company put a pin in its $7.7 billion SPAC merger with Aurora Acquisition Corp. for what it said were “regulatory” reasons.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Bonus: </strong>Here's how the call <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1468709815786553347?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">may have gone</a>.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/08/key-performance-indicators-december-9?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">

Key Performance Indicators

<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>US emergency room visits for suicide attempts by adolescent girls <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/07/science/pandemic-adolescents-depression-anxiety.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surged 51%</a> in early 2021 compared to the same period in 2019, a new report showed Tuesday (they rose 4% for boys). The surgeon general, Dr. Vivek Murthy, warned of a “devastating” mental health crisis among the country’s youth, spurred in part by messages in media and pop culture that “erode their sense of self-worth.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“We’ll be a sanctuary.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">California Gov. Gavin Newsom said that CA’s abortion clinics are preparing to <a href="https://apnews.com/article/abortion-california-sanctuary-625a118108bcda253196697c83548d5b?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">support</a> the influx of patients who will travel from out of state for reproductive care if Roe v. Wade is overturned by the Supreme Court.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Google’s top trending searches in 2021. (<a href="https://trends.google.com/trends/yis/2021/GLOBAL/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Google Trends</a>)</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/08/japanese-billionaire-yusaku-maezawa-docks-at-the-iss?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Oh Look, Another Billionaire Went to Space
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/08/japanese-billionaire-yusaku-maezawa-docks-at-the-iss?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Oh Look, Another Billionaire Went to Space" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/d5ae0d159fbee7d9d41f374e7425db626dd73ca0-2960x1919.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Maxim Blinov/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But like, actual space. Japanese billionaire Yusaku Maezawa docked at the International Space Station yesterday, making him the first self-funded tourist to visit the ISS in <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-59544223?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">over a decade</a>. He’ll spend about 12 days aboard the space station with Russian cosmonaut Alexander Misurkin and Yozo Hirano, a video producer who’s documenting the trip.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For comparison, Jeff Bezos and Richard Branson were each in space for less than 15 minutes, and only Bezos went above the Kármán line, which many consider to be the space–Earth boundary.</span></li></ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What you should know about Maezawa and his trip</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Maezawa, 46, became a billionaire after founding the e-commerce sites Start Today and Zozo (Zozo sold to SoftBank in 2019). He also used to drum in the punk rock band Switch Style.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This certified chiller asked fans to suggest <a href="https://www.yusakumaezawa.com/iss2021/result/en/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">100 activities</a> for him to do in space, which he intends to document and upload to YouTube. They include:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Playing golf</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Hosting a badminton tournament</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Getting a zero-gravity haircut</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Whatever “drinking ‘urine water’” entails</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ganbatte, Maezawa!<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="#">
<font color="#000000">
The Puzzle Section
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>Today’s Mini is a special one—it has approximately <em>0 black squares</em>. We had fun playing it and think <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/08/brew-mini-spice?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">you will, too</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Three Headlines and a Lie</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real and one is faker than a noncompetitive cookie swap. Can you guess the odd one out?</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>This year’s National Finals Rodeo in Vegas has a </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/Y2PaItskOyriE/giphy-downsized-large.gif?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new event</a></span><span>: Horse Hugging</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>NFTs are the big holiday </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-08/nfts-are-the-big-holiday-gift-of-2021-and-they-aren-t-just-for-crypto-lovers?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gift</a></span><span> this year—whether you want one or not</span>

color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nCrypto Comes to Washington\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/Crypto-Executives-Testify-First-Congressional-Hearing?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Digital tokens falling into the Capitol building \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/681474c96379e4b5d7b4ced5bf7092dc3b831fae-1500x1000.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2021, crypto showed up in high-art circles, on NBA jerseys, and in more investment portfolios. So it’s not a surprise that, for the first time ever, the sector also \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/crypto-ceos-to-testify-before-lawmakers-weighing-greater-regulation-11638959403?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emade an appearance\u003c/a\u003e in the halls of Capitol Hill.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSix executives from leading crypto firms, including FTX and Coinbase, testified before the House Financial Services Committee yesterday. It’s part of Congress’s “fact-finding mission” into how to regulate an industry that’s been subject to spottier oversight than the boys in \u003cem\u003eLord of the Flies\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn the nearly 13 years since bitcoin was first introduced, cryptocurrencies have ballooned into a ~$2.6 trillion asset class.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYet the industry is governed by a patchwork of laws rather than an overarching regulatory framework.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo how should it be policed?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUnsurprisingly, industry leaders and lawmakers don’t exactly see eye to eye.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCrypto execs \u003c/strong\u003egenerally want low-touch, \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/markets/europe/us-risks-chilling-regulations-crypto-industry-warns-congress-2021-12-07/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecustom regulations\u003c/a\u003e that promote competition and innovation around blockchain technology. Coinbase CFO Alesia Haas argued yesterday that heavy-handed rules would “effectively push crypto activity underground” or outside the US.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHaas said that crypto markets are fundamentally different from traditional financial markets, and should be treated by regulators as such.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLawmakers, \u003c/strong\u003especifically Democrats, have a number of concerns with how the crypto industry currently operates, including the amount of energy consumed during the mining process and the potential for fraud.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThey’re especially spooked by “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/17/business/economy/federal-reserve-virtual-currency-stablecoin.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003establecoins\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e,” which are cryptocurrencies typically pegged to government-backed currencies. Stablecoins have surged to become a $140 billion market, but regulators think they’re not quite as “stable” as they claim and actually risk \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ede\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003estabilizing financial markets.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eBoth crypto leaders and government regulators agree that some rules of the road are needed for the industry to be sustainable. “Few technologies in history, since antiquity, can persist for long periods of time outside of public policy frameworks,” SEC Chair Gary Gensler \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/livecoverage/wsj-ceo-council-tesla-intel-reddit-pfizer/card/MsUND2c5kqPJC9qYeOAk?mod=article_inline\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe question on everyone’s mind this holiday season: Will existing Covid vaccines work against the new variant, Omicron?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEarly results show that yes, they can, but only after you get knocked on your couch for a \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-science-business-health-coronavirus-vaccine-46a0cedcefcc938ba84ea2868bf69db1?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethird time\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePfizer and its vaccine partner BioNTech released preliminary data yesterday that showed booster shots come as advertised—they increase the level of Omicron-fighting antibodies by 25x when compared to a 2-shot regimen. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDisclaimer: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThese results haven’t gotten the ol’ “peer-reviewed” stamp yet, and need to be scrutinized further.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, this is encouraging news, considering early observations of Omicron sparked concern that existing vaccines wouldn’t be able to neutralize the variant at all. In case more protection is needed, Pfizer and BioNTech are working on an Omicron-specific booster they said could be available by March 2022.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThese results add another wrinkle in the debate over what dosage indicates someone is “fully vaccinated.” Dr. Fauci \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/fauci-fully-vaccinated-definition-covid-pandemic-e32be159-821a-4a5e-bdfb-20e233567685.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold CNN\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that “it’s going to be a matter of when, not if” the style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eVishal Garg, CEO of mortgage company Better.com, broke out a classic exec move and said he was sorry for not respecting his employees. On Tuesday, Garg sent an \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/bettercom-ceo-laid-900-workers-zoom-apologizes-current-staff-rcna8028?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eapology letter\u003c/a\u003e to staff after he laid off 900 employees—at least 9% of the company's total—on a Zoom call last week that had the energy of a middle school surprise anti-drug assembly. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“I own the decision to do the layoffs, but in communicating it I blundered the execution,” wrote Garg.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHe didn’t even have a fun background.\u003c/strong\u003e The CEO’s curt layoff message was followed by a number of frustrated employees \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/hr/stories/2021/12/08/the-host-will-fire-you-now-better-com-ceo-fires?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eventing\u003c/a\u003e on the anonymous discussion website, Blind. Then Garg decided things could only get more fun with the boss around and wrote a series of posts on the same site accusing at least 250 former employees of “stealing” by only working “two hours a day” while clocking in for eight.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe fallout:\u003c/strong\u003e After a rocky week, Better.com’s PR leaders responded by...leaving. Three top communications execs resigned as of yesterday. Plus, the company put a pin in its $7.7 billion SPAC merger with Aurora Acquisition Corp. for what it said were “regulatory” reasons.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp Japanese billionaire Yusaku Maezawa docked at the International Space Station yesterday, making him the first self-funded tourist to visit the ISS in \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-59544223?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eover a decade\u003c/a\u003e. He’ll spend about 12 days aboard the space station with Russian cosmonaut Alexander Misurkin and Yozo Hirano, a video producer who’s documenting the trip.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor comparison, Jeff Bezos and Richard Branson were each in space for less than 15 minutes, and only Bezos went above the Kármán line, which many consider to be the space–Earth boundary.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat you should know about Maezawa and his trip\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMaezawa, 46, became a billionaire after founding the e-commerce sites Start Today and Zozo (Zozo sold to SoftBank in 2019). He also used to drum in the punk rock band Switch Style.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis certified chiller asked fans to suggest \u003ca href=\"https://www.yusakumaezawa.com/iss2021/result/en/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e100 activities\u003c/a\u003e for him to do in space, which he intends to document and upload to YouTube. They include:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePlaying golf\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHosting a badminton tournament\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGetting a zero-gravity haircut\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhatever “drinking ‘urine water’” entails\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGanbatte, Maezawa!\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable
